Aviva Premiership 2012/13 predictions

As rugby fans prepare for the return of the Aviva Premiership on Saturday, Harry Hawkins makes his predictions for the season ahead (Thumbnail credit Last season's champions Harlequins, Image: Fearless Fred via flickr Creative Commons)

A generation inspired

The Olympics have shown just what good a patch of home turf and a few Team GB fans can do to boost national spirit (Thumbnail credit Image: Tab59 via flickr Creative Commons)

Ligue 1 could be set for a revival

With an influx of money and publicity into French football, Titus Carey argues that Ligue 1 could soon be considered as one of the strongest leagues in Europe (Thumbnail credit New PSG signing Zlatan Ibrahimovic, Image: jeanfrancois beausejour via flickr Creative Commons)

Premier League Predictions 2012/13

The <em>Nouse</em> Sport team make their predictions for the coming season, as the Premier League returns to fill the post-Olympic void (Thumbnail credit Image: Stuart Grout via flickr Creative Commons)

Woods can finally meet expectations in year's final major

With the PGA Championship taking place this week, Neil Johnston assesses the contenders for golf's last major of the year (Thumbnail credit Image: Keith Allison via flickr Creative Commons)

Olympic champions deserve our respect, not suspicion

Admiration, rather than accusations of doping, should be the immediate reaction to record-breaking Olympic success (Thumbnail credit The Olympic Rings in front of the Aquatic Centre, Image: Swamibu via flickr Creative Commons)

England must respond to South Africa mauling

After the disappointing innings defeat England suffered last week, they must pull themselves together if they are to win the test series against South Africa and retain their number one world ranking (Thumbnail credit Image: thesportreview via flickr Creative Commons)

Consistency key as Alonso continues to show his class

As the Formula One season reaches the halfway point, Fernando Alonso has shown that he is a cut above the rest to lead the Drivers' Championship (Thumbnail credit Alonso after winning the Valencia Grand Prix last month, Image: PresidenciaGVA via flickr Creative Commons)

Excellent Els a worthy Open winner

Neil Johnston reviews a thrilling climax to the Open Championship, after Ernie Els produced a superb display to claim the Claret Jug (Thumbnail credit Image: SD Dirk via flickr Creative Commons)

Time for golf's big names to step up at Lytham

Neil Johnston assesses the main contenders ahead of The Open at Royal Lytham and St Annes (Thumbnail credit Luke Donald is in search of his first major win, Image: Keith Allison via flickr Creative Commons)

Lightning Bolt's shot at immortality

Three weeks away from the Olympic 100m final, Dan Holland casts his eye over the fastest man in the world (Thumbnail credit Image: friskytuna via flickr Creative Commons)

Microphones the answer to football's ill discipline

Sam Shepherd outlines the case for fitting referees with microphones to improve footballers' conduct on the pitch (Thumbnail credit Image: Globovision via flickr Creative Commons)

Back 'Le Bid' for Yorkshire

With Yorkshire seeking to host the opening stage of the 2016 Tour de France, Alex Slingsby says we should all get behind 'Le Bid' (Thumbnail credit Image: jomenager via flickr Creative Commons)

Murray must make progress regardless of Wimbledon outcome

Dan Holland assesses Andy Murray's chances of winning Wimbledon and moving on to greater success in the future (Thumbnail credit Image: mirsasha via flickr Creative Commons)

Robin van Persie - The Modern-Day Footballer

Jack Bradshaw gives his take on the Robin van Persie transfer saga, after the striker announced that he will not be signing a new contract at Arsenal (Thumbnail credit Image: Ronnie Macdonald via flickr Creative Commons)

Spain's boredom-inducing brilliance

Sean Cole asks if Spain's increasingly methodical style of play is undermining their success (Thumbnail credit Spain celebrate winning the 2010 World Cup, Image: myprofe via flickr Creative Commons)

My sporting experiences at York

Luke Gardener reflects on his three years of sport at York

US Open set to be full of surprises

Neil Johnston looks at the contenders for golf's US Open, with the action starting at the Olympic Club tomorrow (Thumbnail credit Last year's winner Rory McIlroy, Image: Ed (supergolfdude) via flickr Creative Commons)

Nouse Sport Euro 2012 Predictions

With Euro 2012 starting this Friday, the <em>Nouse</em> Sport team offer their 'expert' opinions on who will shine in Poland and Ukraine

The class of 2007: How Holland's youngsters lost their way

Sean Cole examines the waning fortunes of the Dutch players that looked set for stardom after winning the U21 European Championships in 2007 (Thumbnail credit The Dutch side celebrating winning the U21 European Championships in 2007, Image: Antoon's Foobar via flickr Creative Commons )

College Cup living up to expectations

With exam season in full swing and dissertation deadlines passing, sport has seemingly taken a backseat after the frantic nature of Roses 2012 in Lancaster

10 of the best Championship prospects

With the Championship season coming to a close this weekend, Sean Cole picks out 10 of the league's best young players (Thumbnail credit Cardiff's Joe Mason, Image: joncandy via flickr Creative Commons)

Roses 2012 set to be a thriller

Luke Gardener looks ahead to this year's Roses tournament in Lancaster

A parting of the ways for Pulis and Stoke?

Sean Cole asks if Stoke have reached the peak of their powers under Tony Pulis, and if the time has come for change at the Britannia (Thumbnail credit Image: Staffs.Live via flickr Creative Commons)

Cup coup makes Liverpool's season a success

Rohan Banerjee argues that a potential cup double for Liverpool represents a successful season, regardless of their faltering league form (Thumbnail credit Liverpool have won just five of 17 league games at Anfield, yet could win two trophies, Image: theMatthewBlack via flickr Creative Commons)

PFA Awards should be more open

Dan Holland argues that there should be more to the PFA Awards than simply parading the Premier League's best. (Thumbnail credit Robin van Persie is the favourite for this season's top prize, Image: Ronnie Macdonald via flickr Creative Commons)

By James Bithell

Harry Hawkins evaluates the role rugby sevens tournaments can play in expanding the game's reach. (Thumbnail credit World Cup winner Jason Robinson at the Rosslyn Park HSBC National Schools Sevens)

Watson win a fitting end to thrilling Masters

Neil Johnston reviews a stunning final day at Augusta, where Bubba Watson was the surprise victor. (Thumbnail credit Watson secured his first major by beating Louis Oosthuizen in a play-off, Image: jpellgen via flickr Creative Commons)

'Arry up and give Redknapp the job

Rohan Banerjee argues that the FA need to appoint Harry Redknapp as England manager sooner rather than later (Thumbnail credit Redknapp (right) is still to be approached for the England job, Image: Beacon Radio via flickr Creative Commons)

Neil Johnston casts his eye over the contenders for golf's first major of the year. (Thumbnail credit Tiger Woods is the pre-tournament favourite, Image: Keith Allison via flickr Creative Commons)
